info.headline: Flood Warning issued August 17 at 9:44AM CDT until August 17 at 3:30PM CDT by NWS Aberdeen SD
info.description:
* WHAT...Flooding caused by excessive rainfall is expected.
* WHERE...A portion of northeast South Dakota, including the following county, Day.
* WHEN...Until 330 PM CDT.
* IMPACTS...Flooding of rivers, creeks, streams, and other low-lying and flood-prone locations is imminent or occurring.
* ADDITIONAL DETAILS... - At 940 AM CDT, Emergency management reported heavy rain in the warned area due to thunderstorms. Flooding is already occurring. Between 1 and 2 inches of rain have fallen. - Officials advise motorists to drive with care due to soft roadways and saturated ground. - Some locations that will experience flooding include... Webster, Waubay, Bristol, Enemy Swim Housing, Roslyn, Pierpont, Andover, Grenville, Holmquist, Opitz Lake, Waubay Lake, Minnewasta Lake, Rush Lake, Waubay Wildlife Rec Area, Piyas Lake, Blue Dog Lake, Pickerel Lake Rec Area, Campbell Slough, Enemy Swim Lake and western Lake Traverse Reservation. - http://www.weather.gov/safety/flood
info.instruction:
Turn around, don't drown when encountering flooded roads. Most flood deaths occur in vehicles.
Stay away or be swept away. River banks and culverts can become unstable and unsafe.
Please report observed flooding to local emergency services or law enforcement and request they pass this information to the National Weather Service when you can do so safely.

parameter.value: FLOOD WARNING IN EFFECT UNTIL 330 PM CDT THIS AFTERNOON
